Topic.Title: Oh please no! Can't open my game anymore! HELP!

Posts.EditableText: Okay, I'm seriously at the edge of tears over here! I spent a great LOT of time and effort to create a quest game, I was really proud of it, I saved it under two different names for security in case my comp screws up, and then, when I wanted to open it up with my QDK to add something, I couldn't load it abnymore! Obviously the "print a message" text "AAAAA. BB. ABAB. <><>" created a failure, but I can't repair it because QDK won't let me open the game menu! Please, seriously! Anybody know something I can do? Alex? Please, tell me there's a way I can repair this!
Posts.HTML:
Okay, I'm seriously at the edge of tears over here! I spent a great LOT of time and effort to create a quest game, I was really proud of it, I saved it under two different names for security in case my comp screws up, and then, when I wanted to open it up with my QDK to add something, I couldn't load it abnymore!
Obviously the "print a message" text "AAAAA. BB. ABAB. <><>" created a failure, but I can't repair it because QDK won't let me open the game menu!
Please, seriously! Anybody know something I can do? Alex?
Please, tell me there's a way I can repair this!

Posts.EditableText:
You can open your ASL file in Notepad to edit the line that is causing the problem.

Alternatively, email it to me and I'll fix it for you.
Posts.HTML:
You can open your ASL file in Notepad to edit the line that is causing the problem.

Alternatively, email it to me and I'll fix it for you.

Posts.EditableText: Okay, I found Notepad. It worked. Oh thank you so much, Alex! I can't exclaim just how bad it would have been for me to lose this game.
Posts.HTML: Okay, I found Notepad. It worked. Oh thank you so much, Alex! I can't exclaim just how bad it would have been for me to lose this game.

Posts.EditableText: If you need '<' and '>' to be printed you can use '$symbol(lt)$' and '$symbol(gt)$' and it'll print then out.
Posts.HTML: If you need '<' and '>' to be printed you can use '$symbol(lt)$' and '$symbol(gt)$' and it'll print then out.

Posts.EditableText:
I Use the automatic backup feature, go to Tools/Options and
you'll see a tab that says Auto Save, I Have my prejects save
every 2 minutes up to 25 copies!, It helped me allot.
Posts.HTML:
